publicationstmt.publisher: Free Library of Philadelphia, Print and Picture Collection

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: Free Library of Philadelphia, Print and Picture Collection

bioghist.p: Among the exemplary collections of the Free Library of Philadelphia is the Print and Picture Collection. Spanning the graphic arts from 1493 to the present time, the Free Library's Fine Art Prints and Photographs collection includes thousands of images. Initially representing only Philadelphia artists, the collection has been extended to include early masters as well as renowned modern printmakers and photographers.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of 5" x 7" and 8" x 10" black and white photographic negatives of properties in Philadelphia and the vicinity, including Mongomery, Berks, Delaware, and Chester counties. There are also some negatives from Delaware, New Jersey, and New York. Images are of industrial and business properties and residences. There are occasional interior shots, a small batch of aerial negatives, and miscellaneous photographs of damage to properties and automobiles. The collection also includes three binders of 8 x 10 prints of downtown Philadelphia from the late 1940s and early 1950s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
